content: Will drone delivery lower the cost of shipping? That’s my question. Yes, taking the human element, not to mention fuel costs, out of the labor equation is certainly an attractive idea. And widespread use will certainly lower the carbon footprint somewhat. But then FAA regulations (already in place with recreational drones — you need to register them), taxes on shipping, liability insurance (a delivery drone is certain to take out someone’s antenna, roof, what have you — can’t wait to read about that lawsuit some day!), drone maintenance, and so on, will also add to the costs of getting you your pizza. One last question: how much do you have to tip the drones?
